briefdescription.para: May be overridden to implement testing for empty cells.

detaileddescription.para: This method is used by the grid to test if the given cell is not used and so whether a neighbouring cell may overflow into it. By default it only returns true if the value of the given cell, as returned by GetValue(), is empty.

briefdescription.para: Same as IsEmptyCell() but taking wxGridCellCoords.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that this method is not virtual, only IsEmptyCell() should be overridden.

briefdescription.para: Must be overridden to implement accessing the table values as text.
Must be overridden to implement setting the table values as text.
Returns the type of the value in the given cell.

detaileddescription.para: By default all cells are strings and this method returns wxGRID_VALUE_STRING.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the value of the given cell can be accessed as if it were of the specified type.

detaileddescription.para: By default the cells can only be accessed as strings. Note that a cell could be accessible in different ways, e.g. a numeric cell may return true for wxGRID_VALUE_NUMBER but also for wxGRID_VALUE_STRING indicating that the value can be coerced to a string form.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the value of the given cell can be set as if it were of the specified type.
Returns the value of the given cell as a long.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanGetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_NUMBER argument. Default implementation always return 0.

briefdescription.para: Returns the value of the given cell as a double.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanGetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_FLOAT argument. Default implementation always return 0.0.

briefdescription.para: Returns the value of the given cell as a boolean.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanGetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_BOOL argument. Default implementation always return false.

briefdescription.para: Returns the value of the given cell as a user-defined type.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanGetValueAs() returns true when called with typeName. Default implementation always return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the given cell as a long.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanSetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_NUMBER argument. Default implementation doesn't do anything.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the given cell as a double.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanSetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_FLOAT argument. Default implementation doesn't do anything.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the given cell as a boolean.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanSetValueAs() returns true when called with wxGRID_VALUE_BOOL argument. Default implementation doesn't do anything.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, const wxString &typeName, void *value)
memberdef.name: SetValueAsCustom

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the given cell as a user-defined type.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be called if CanSetValueAs() returns true when called with typeName. Default implementation doesn't do anything.

description.para: Notice that none of these functions are pure virtual as they don't have to be implemented if the table structure is never modified after creation, i.e.

neither rows nor columns are never added or deleted but that you do need to implement them if they are called, i.e. if your code either calls them directly or uses the matching wxGrid methods, as by default they simply do nothing which is definitely inappropriate.

briefdescription.para: Clear the table contents.

detaileddescription.para: This method is used by wxGrid::ClearGrid().

briefdescription.para: Insert additional rows into the table.

parameterdescription.para: The position of the first new row.
The number of rows to insert.

briefdescription.para: Append additional rows at the end of the table.

detaileddescription.para: This method is provided in addition to InsertRows() as some data models may only support appending rows to them but not inserting them at arbitrary locations. In such case you may implement this method only and leave InsertRows() unimplemented.

parameterdescription.para: The number of rows to add.

briefdescription.para: Delete rows from the table.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that currently deleting a row intersecting a multi-cell (see SetCellSize()) is not supported and will result in a crash.

parameterdescription.para: The number of rows to delete.

briefdescription.para: Exactly the same as InsertRows() but for columns.
Exactly the same as AppendRows() but for columns.
Exactly the same as DeleteRows() but for columns.

description.para: By default the numbers are used for labeling rows and Latin letters for labeling columns.
If the table has more than 26 columns, the pairs of letters are used starting from the 27-th one and so on, i.e. the sequence of labels is A, B, ..., Z, AA, AB, ..., AZ, BA, ..., ..., ZZ, AAA, ...

briefdescription.para: Return the label of the specified row.
Return the label of the specified column.
Set the given label for the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: The default version does nothing, i.e. the label is not stored. You must override this method in your derived class if you wish wxGrid::SetRowLabelValue() to work.

briefdescription.para: Exactly the same as SetRowLabelValue() but for columns.

description.para: By default the attributes management is delegated to wxGridCellAttrProvider class.
You may override the methods in this section to handle the attributes directly if, for example, they can be computed from the cell values.

briefdescription.para: Associate this attributes provider with the table.

detaileddescription.para: The table takes ownership of attrProvider pointer and will delete it when it doesn't need it any more. The pointer can be NULL, however this won't disable attributes management in the table but will just result in a default attributes being recreated the next time any of the other functions in this section is called. To completely disable the attributes support, should this be needed, you need to override CanHaveAttributes() to return false.

briefdescription.para: Returns the attribute provider currently being used.

detaileddescription.para: This function may return NULL if the attribute provider hasn't been neither associated with this table by SetAttrProvider() nor created on demand by any other methods.

briefdescription.para: Return the attribute for the given cell.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function is simply forwarded to wxGridCellAttrProvider::GetAttr() but it may be overridden to handle attributes directly in the table.

briefdescription.para: Set attribute of the specified cell.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function is simply forwarded to wxGridCellAttrProvider::SetAttr().
The table takes ownership of attr, i.e. will call DecRef() on it.

briefdescription.para: Set attribute of the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function is simply forwarded to wxGridCellAttrProvider::SetRowAttr().
The table takes ownership of attr, i.e. will call DecRef() on it.

briefdescription.para: Set attribute of the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function is simply forwarded to wxGridCellAttrProvider::SetColAttr().
The table takes ownership of attr, i.e. will call DecRef() on it.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Destructor frees the attribute provider if it was created.
Must be overridden to return the number of rows in the table.

detaileddescription.para: For backwards compatibility reasons, this method is not const. Use GetRowsCount() instead of it in const methods of derived table classes.

briefdescription.para: Must be overridden to return the number of columns in the table.

detaileddescription.para: For backwards compatibility reasons, this method is not const. Use GetColsCount() instead of it in const methods of derived table classes,

briefdescription.para: Return the number of rows in the table.

detaileddescription.para: This method is not virtual and is only provided as a convenience for the derived classes which can't call GetNumberRows() without a const_cast from their const methods.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of columns in the table.

detaileddescription.para: This method is not virtual and is only provided as a convenience for the derived classes which can't call GetNumberCols() without a const_cast from their const methods.

briefdescription.para: Called by the grid when the table is associated with it.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation stores the pointer and returns it from its GetView() and so only makes sense if the table cannot be associated with more than one grid at a time.

briefdescription.para: Returns the last grid passed to SetView().
Returns true if this table supports attributes or false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: By default, the table automatically creates a wxGridCellAttrProvider when this function is called if it had no attribute provider before and returns true.

briefdescription.para: The almost abstract base class for grid tables.

detaileddescription.para: A grid table is responsible for storing the grid data and, indirectly, grid cell attributes. The data can be stored in the way most convenient for the application but has to be provided in string form to wxGrid. It is also possible to provide cells values in other formats if appropriate, e.g. as numbers.

This base class is not quite abstract as it implements a trivial strategy for storing the attributes by forwarding it to wxGridCellAttrProvider and also provides stubs for some other functions. However it does have a number of pure virtual methods which must be implemented in the derived classes.
Library:wxAdvanced
Category:Grid Related Classes
